topics.title: Overview
topics.content:
## Automations

Schedule recurring AI agent tasks using cron expressions. Automations run quick agents on a schedule, making it easy to set up regular code reviews, reports, cleanups, or any repeatable task.

Schedules are evaluated locally — automations only run when Clubhouse is open and the project is active.

topics.title: Key Features
topics.content:
## Key Features

**Create Automations** — Click **+ Add** or use the command palette. Set a name, cron schedule, model, and prompt.

**Cron Scheduling** — Use preset schedules (every 15 min, hourly, daily, weekly, monthly) or write custom 5-field cron expressions (`minute hour day-of-month month day-of-week`).

**Model Selection** — Choose which AI model runs the automation.

**Enable/Disable** — Toggle automations on or off without deleting them.

**Run History** — View recent runs with status (running/completed/failed), timestamps, and expandable summaries. Stop running agents or delete old run records.

topics.title: Commands
topics.content:
## Commands

Available from the command palette:

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **Create Automation** | Opens the creation form for a new automation |
| **Refresh Automations** | Reloads the automation list |

topics.title: Permissions
topics.content:
## Permissions

| Permission | Why it's needed |
|------------|----------------|
| **storage** | Persist automations, schedules, and run history |
| **agents** | Spawn quick agents and monitor their status |
| **commands** | Register command palette entries |
| **notifications** | Show alerts when automations complete or fail |
| **navigation** | Focus running agent panels |
| **widgets** | Render completed agent summaries |
| **theme** | Adapt colors and styles to the current theme |
